title: HW2 Q3
content: Problem context: This problem lets you see the ideas of optimization and initialization play out in the context of real dataset: CIFAR10 using fully-connected neural nets.The problem also lets you play with some of the standard kinds of plots that one uses in deep learning.
document:
Problem context: This problem lets you see the ideas of optimization and initialization play out in the context of real dataset: CIFAR10 using fully-connected neural nets.

The problem also lets you play with some of the standard kinds of plots that one uses in deep learning.

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Do we submit the submission materials at the end of this notebook? Since Problem 4 explicitly asks us to submit a pdf of the notebook, and problem 6 pretty clearly tells us to just answer the written questions, I figured I'd ask here.</paragraph></document>
comments.document: Do we submit the submission materials at the end of this notebook? Since Problem 4 explicitly asks us to submit a pdf of the notebook, and problem 6 pretty clearly tells us to just answer the written questions, I figured I'd ask here.

comments.content:
In addition, just warning everyone that for cell 4 in the notebook on Google collab, replace:
%cd $SYM_PATH!git clone https://github.com/Berkeley-CS182/cs182sp25_public.git%cd cs182sp25_public/hw02/q_coding_optimizer_init/code
with:
%cd $SYM_PATH!git clone https://github.com/Berkeley-CS182/cs182fa25_public.git%cd cs182fa25_public/hw02/code
If you do not do this, you will not be able to download the data for the question. Additionally, for cell 2, replace:
DRIVE_PATH = '/content/gdrive/My\ Drive/cs182hw2_sp25'
with
DRIVE_PATH = '/content/gdrive/My\\ Drive/cs182hw2_fa25'

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>In the Problem 3, the last step is to zip all the files into a .zip and should we submit that .zip file on gradescope or should we just include a pdf of Problem 3? The output of Problem 3 is a bit long and print it out to pdf does not align well though. I am wondering how we should submit that.</paragraph></document>

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>Hi all, the important part is that your submitted HW provides evidence that you worked out the problems properly. In this case, feel free to submit either the .zip, or a PDF with your filled-out notebook and the corresponding outputs.</paragraph><paragraph/></document>
comments.document: Hi all, the important part is that your submitted HW provides evidence that you worked out the problems properly. In this case, feel free to submit either the .zip, or a PDF with your filled-out notebook and the corresponding outputs.

comments.content: <document version="2.0"><paragraph>If anyone is looking for a nicer way to save the notebook to a pdf, check out this <link href="https://colab.research.google.com/github/Mostafa-MR/Convert_ipynb_to_HTML_in_Colab/blob/main/Convert_ipynb_to_HTML_in_Colab.ipynb">open source ipynb -> html converter</link> I found online. Just download your notebook as an ipynb, upload it as directed to the converter, then print to pdf the resulting html webpage. Super quick & easy.</paragraph></document>
comments.document: If anyone is looking for a nicer way to save the notebook to a pdf, check out this open source ipynb -> html converter I found online. Just download your notebook as an ipynb, upload it as directed to the converter, then print to pdf the resulting html webpage. Super quick & easy.
